title: Bangladesh Ex PM Khaleda Zia Freed Day After Rival Sheikh Hasina's Ouster
content: Khaleda Zia is in poor health, confined to a wheelchair with rheumatoid arthritis and struggling with diabetes and cirrhosis of the liver.

title: Explained: The Google Antitrust Case
content: The ruling comes after a 10-week trial and is a major victory for the US Justice Department, which filed the lawsuit nearly four years ago.Â

title: Opinion: Here's Everything India May Lose If Middle East Plunges Into A Full-Blown War
content: Modi's huge investment in West Asia diplomacy and increased engagements may come unhinged if tensions spread and engulf the region in a wider war.
summary: Modi's huge investment in West Asia diplomacy and increased engagements may come unhinged if tensions spread and engulf the region in a wider war.

title: 45 Palestinians Killed In Gaza In 24 Hours As Heavy Fighting Continues
content: Israeli forces killed 45 Palestinian fighters in Gaza over the past day, the military said on Tuesday, after heavy fighting in which Hamas said it destroyed two armoured personnel carriers during an ambush near the city of Rafah.
summary: Israeli forces killed 45 Palestinian fighters in Gaza over the past day, the military said on Tuesday, after heavy fighting in which Hamas said it destroyed two armoured personnel carriers during an ambush near the city of Rafah.

title: Pakistani Climbers Rescue Porter's Body A Year After K2 Summit
content: Climbers recovered the body of a Pakistani porter from K2 mountain, a climbing federation confirmed Tuesday, a year after he died while other climbers made a record-breaking ascent.
summary: Climbers recovered the body of a Pakistani porter from K2 mountain, a climbing federation confirmed Tuesday, a year after he died while other climbers made a record-breaking ascent.

title: Human Remains Found Inside Crocodile After Man Goes Missing In Australia
content: The incident occurred at a location known as Crocodile Bend, popular among tourists for crocodile sightings.
summary: The incident occurred at a location known as Crocodile Bend, popular among tourists for crocodile sightings.

title: Lebanon's Hezbollah Launches Swarm Of Drones At Israel
content: Lebanon's armed group Hezbollah said it launched a swarm of attack drones against military targets in northern Israel on Tuesday.
summary: Lebanon's armed group Hezbollah said it launched a swarm of attack drones against military targets in northern Israel on Tuesday.

title: Iran Yet To Make Arrests After Suspected Israeli Killing Of Hamas Chief
content: Iran-Israel Conflict:The leader of the Palestinian militant group was killed last Wednesday during a visit for the swearing-in ceremony of Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian. The "necessary investigations" have begun and the results will be announce

title: Sheikh Rehana, Hasina's Lifelong Shadow After Massacre Wiped Off Family
content: Sheikh Rehana was with her elder sister Hasina in Europe when her father and Bangladesh president Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, mother Begum Fazilatunnesa and brothers Kamal, Jamal and Russel were massacred on August 15, 1975 during a military coup
summary: Sheikh Rehana was with her elder sister Hasina in Europe when her father and Bangladesh president Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, mother Begum Fazilatunnesa and brothers Kamal, Jamal and Russel were massacred on August 15, 1975 during a military coup

title: Russia Detains Italian Man For Flying A Drone Near The Kremlin
content: An Italian man has been detained in Moscow after flying a drone near the Kremlin, state news agency TASS reported on Tuesday, citing law enforcement sources.
summary: An Italian man has been detained in Moscow after flying a drone near the Kremlin, state news agency TASS reported on Tuesday, citing law enforcement sources.

title: ''Help The Planet'': Climate Activists Spray-Paint Lionel Messi's Mansion
content: Climate activists on Tuesday spray-painted a mansion on the Spanish holiday island of Ibiza belonging to Argentina football star Lionel Messi to highlight the "responsibility of the rich for the climate crisis".
summary: Climate activists on Tuesday spray-painted a mansion on the Spanish holiday island of Ibiza belonging to Argentina football star Lionel Messi to highlight the "responsibility of the rich for the climate crisis".

title: Bangladesh Parliament Dissolved A Day After Sheikh Hasina's Ouster
content: Bangladesh's president dissolved parliament on Tuesday, a key demand of student protesters who led demonstrations that ousted long time ruler Sheikh Hasina, a statement read.
summary: Bangladesh's president dissolved parliament on Tuesday, a key demand of student protesters who led demonstrations that ousted long time ruler Sheikh Hasina, a statement read.

title: South Korea To Ban Citizens Going To Border Areas Of Lebanon And Israel
content: South Korea said on Tuesday it will issue a ban on its citizens travelling to the border areas of Israel and Lebanon after advising them to leave the countries amid escalating tensions in the Middle East.
summary: South Korea said on Tuesday it will issue a ban on its citizens travelling to the border areas of Israel and Lebanon after advising them to leave the countries amid escalating tensions in the Middle East.

title: After Sheikh Hasina Ouster, Arch-Rival Khaleda Zia Freed From House Arrest
content: Bangladesh's ex-prime minister Khaleda Zia has been released from years of house arrest after her bitter enemy Sheikh Hasina was ousted as premier, her party said Tuesday.
summary: Bangladesh's ex-prime minister Khaleda Zia has been released from years of house arrest after her bitter enemy Sheikh Hasina was ousted as premier, her party said Tuesday.

title: Want To Live Longer? German Firm Aims To Bring You Back From Dead
content: The company claims that the body can be willingly revived in the future and cause of death treated.

title: Delta CEO Slams Microsoft As "Most Fragile" Platform After Global Outage
content: Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian declared Microsoft "the most fragile" platform after a massive IT outage last month caused chaos across the world.
summary: Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian declared Microsoft "the most fragile" platform after a massive IT outage last month caused chaos across the world.

title: "Sheikh Hasina Requested To Come, Situation Still Evolving": S Jaishankar
content: The government is in close touch with the nearly 19,000 Indian nationals - almost half of whom are students - in Bangladesh, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar told Parliament Tuesday afternoon.
summary: The government is in close touch with the nearly 19,000 Indian nationals - almost half of whom are students - in Bangladesh, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar told Parliament Tuesday afternoon.

title: When Sheikh Hasina Accused Nobel Winner Yunus Of "Sucking Blood Of Poor"
content: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, the pioneer of the global microcredit movement who could shepherd Bangladesh's new interim government, was an arch foe of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina who has resigned and fled the country.
summary: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, the pioneer of the global microcredit movement who could shepherd Bangladesh's new interim government, was an arch foe of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina who has resigned and fled the country.

title: Opinion: A Post-Hasina Bangladesh Doesn't Seem Like A Great Friend For India
content: Hasinas resignation is possibly one of the biggest strategic shocks for New Delhi in recent years. Her governments economic and foreign policy fostered a strong bond with India and made it a hub of regional connectivity and integration.
summary: Hasinas resignation is possibly one of the biggest strategic shocks for New Delhi in recent years. Her governments economic and foreign policy fostered a strong bond with India and made it a hub of regional connectivity and integration.

title: Amit Mehta, Indian-American Judge Behind Landmark Google Antitrust Ruling
content: Amit Mehta, an Indian-origin US judge, has handed Google a legal blow, ruling that the tech giant used exclusive agreements to make itself the "default" search engine and ad provider on devices, giving it a major advantage over its rivals.
summary: Amit Mehta, an Indian-origin US judge, has handed Google a legal blow, ruling that the tech giant used exclusive agreements to make itself the "default" search engine and ad provider on devices, giving it a major advantage over its rivals.
